AllText.heroDescription: An aspiring learner who is always curious to learn new things, experiment, look for solutions, and grab opportunities! Currently, I am focused on
AllText.AboutParaOne: I am a passionate and dedicated cybersecurity enthusiast with a strong foundation in digital forensics, vulnerability assessments, and ethical hacking. Over the years, I have gained hands-on experience in areas such as vulnerability assessment and penetration testing (VAPT), Linux fundamentals, programming basics, and cybersecurity awareness.
AllText.AboutParaTwo: My journey has been enriched by certifications from TCM Security, internships, and active participation in industry events like OWASP meetups and hackathons. Through my internship at the Center for Cyber Security Studies & Research, I deepened my understanding of tools like Acunetix, Nessus, and Nmap.
AllText.AboutParaThree: I enjoy creating educational content such as writeups and walkthroughs for cybersecurity tools and challenges. My goal is to share knowledge and inspire others to develop their cybersecurity skills while contributing to a safer digital world.

projects.Title: Pwnagotchi
projects.Description: Developed an AI-powered Wi-Fi hacking tool designed to learn and optimize attacks using machine learning.

projects.Title: Sunset:1
projects.Description: Test your penetration testing skills with the Sunset:1 machine from VulnHub. Explore enumeration, exploit vulnerabilities, and escalate privileges to root.

projects.Title: Home Lab
projects.Description: Set up a virtualized cybersecurity testing environment with Kali Linux and Windows 10 virtual machines.

projects.Title: Introduction to VAPT: Tools, Attacks, and Methodologies
projects.Description: A detailed exploration of Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Testing tools, including Nmap, Nessus, and Burp Suite, combined with insights into OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities.

projects.Title: Image Steganography GUI using Python
projects.Description: A GUI-based Image Steganography tool built with Python, OpenCV, and Tkinter, allowing users to securely hide and retrieve messages within images, featuring a sleek Windows 11-like UI.

projects.Title: Step-by-Step Guide: Installing Windows & Kali Linux VMs on VMware Workstation Pro
projects.Description: A detailed guide on setting up Windows and Kali Linux virtual machines using VMware Workstation Pro, covering installation, configuration, and optimization for cybersecurity testing.

projects.Title: PortSwigger Lab: File path traversal, simple case
projects.Description: A walkthrough on exploiting file path traversal vulnerabilities in a PortSwigger lab to access sensitive files using Burp Suite and Linux commands

projects.Title: PortSwigger Lab: File path traversal, traversal sequences blocked with absolute path bypass
projects.Description: A walkthrough on bypassing restricted traversal sequences using absolute paths to exploit file path traversal vulnerabilities in a PortSwigger lab.

projects.Title: PortSwigger Lab: File path traversal, traversal sequences stripped non-recursively
projects.Description: A walkthrough on exploiting file path traversal vulnerabilities by bypassing non-recursively stripped traversal sequences in a PortSwigger lab.

projects.Title: PortSwigger Lab: File path traversal, traversal sequences stripped with superfluous URL-decode
projects.Description: A walkthrough on exploiting file path traversal vulnerabilities by leveraging superfluous URL decoding to bypass restricted sequences in a PortSwigger lab.

projects.Title: PortSwigger Lab: File path traversal, validation of start of path
projects.Description: A walkthrough on bypassing path validation checks by modifying the filename parameter to exploit file path traversal vulnerabilities and access restricted files in a PortSwigger lab.

projects.Title: PortSwigger Lab: File path traversal, validation of file extension with null byte bypass
projects.Description: A walkthrough on bypassing file extension validation using a null byte injection to exploit file path traversal vulnerabilities in a PortSwigger lab.
